summary: This Request for Information (RFI) from the General Services Administration (GSA) seeks information from potential vendors regarding cloud-based website support and development services. The GSA aims to consolidate and modernize its IT website infrastructure, likely to improve user experience, enhance security, and streamline operations. The core objective is to migrate and consolidate multiple legacy federal websites or applications into a unified, cloud-based platform. The client is looking for a comprehensive solution that includes development, hosting, operations, and maintenance. The key business challenge addressed is the need to update and optimize the GSA's digital presence, ensuring it meets current federal standards for accessibility, security, and user experience. The RFI explores various aspects, including organizational experience, technical capabilities (Agile, DevSecOps, CI/CD), cloud platform support (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), security and compliance (FISMA, FedRAMP), and website migration and consolidation strategies. The GSA is also interested in understanding pricing models, team structure, and vendor qualifications. A unique aspect of this RFI is the emphasis on transitioning existing platforms while maintaining continuity of operations and existing ATOs.

objectives: Migrate and consolidate multiple legacy federal websites.
Ensure compliance with federal web standards (Section 508, USWDS).
Improve website performance and user experience.
